intro: Filipendula hexapetala var. pleniflora, commonly known as the clustered lady's mantle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It is characterized by its dense, rounded clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has heart-shaped, toothed leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery down. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. The botanical features of this variety make it a distinctive and ornamental addition to gardens and natural habitats.
